intro: Mentzelia congesta var. davidsoniana, commonly known as Davidson's clustered blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescence that blooms in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in arid environments.
